definition: tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: The big black Bakelite phone rang at half past ten.
sentences.chinese: 十点半的时候，外壳用胶木做的电话响了。

sentences.english: Bakelite handle, fine heat-resistance , handy, convenient, large quantity of steam.
sentences.chinese: 胶木手柄，耐温性好，轻巧方便，气量大。

sentences.english: At present but endowment the lumber resource that use basically has balata wood and eucalyptus wood.
sentences.chinese: 目前可资利用的木材资源主要有橡胶木和桉木。

sentences.english: But unlike Celluloid, Bakelite would not catch on fire or melt.
sentences.chinese: 与赛璐珞不同，胶木不会着火或融化。

sentences.english: Bakelite still has some of its classic applications in automotive and electrical products.
sentences.chinese: 胶木在汽车和电器产品仍然有一些传统的应用。

sentences.english: But Bakelite is still being made, for wide-ranging applications.
sentences.chinese: 但胶木依然广泛地应用。

sentences.english: Finaly, a drying schedule for rubber wood was introduced and description about the autocontrol process was included.
sentences.chinese: 也探讨了橡胶木的干燥基准和过程自动控制问题。

sentences.english: That was how the first Bakelite was made for sale in 1909.
sentences.chinese: 这就是1909年首次生产销售用胶木的实际情况。

sentences.english: Bakelite Corp. worked closely with designers to promote the plastic.
sentences.chinese: 胶木公司与设计师紧密合作，以推广塑料。

definition: bakelite (early plastic)/also written 膠木|胶木[jiao1 mu4]
yellow gum/xanthanate gum (polysaccharide food additive used as a thickener)
acetal resin/Delrin/unplasticized polyvinyl chloride (uPVC or rigid PVC)
cellulose acetate (used for film and fiber)
to spread litter in a cowshed, pigsty etc
phenolic aldehyde/phenolic resin (used to manufacture bakelite)
